teach2000.model.lists

Class ListIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • teach2000.model.lists.ListIO

  • public class ListIO
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a dedicated IO class for List with only static methods. Everything IO-related is separated from the main List class. By default, the location is a folder per user in the resources/lists/ directory. Lists are always written as a binary file in the following format: LISTID LANG_FROM LANG_TO NAME NO_OF_QUESTIONS QUESTION ANSWER NO_OF_ALTERNATIVES ALTERNATIVES For the reading and writing of the questions themselves, QuestionIO must be used.
    Author:
    Kristof Buts

    • Method Detail

      • readAllLists

        public static java.util.ArrayList<List> readAllLists(java.lang.String userid)
        This method reads all lists stored in the passed in user's folder. It loops through all the files and compiles one ArrayList that can be assigned to the user.
        Parameters:
        userid - ID of the user we want to read the lists for
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of List elements that contains all the lists stored for the user

      • readList

        public static List readList(java.lang.String userid,
                            java.lang.String listid)
        Reads in one list when given a User ID and List ID.
        Parameters:
        userid - ID of the user
        listid - ID of the list
        Returns:
        List object that was read from disk

      • readList

        public static List readList(java.io.File file)
        Reads in one list when given a File object, e.g. returned from a FileChooser.
        Parameters:
        file - File object representing the List file
        Returns:
        List object that was read from disk.

      • writeList

        public static void writeList(java.lang.String userid,
                             List list)
        Writes one List to disk in the default user folder.
        Parameters:
        userid - ID of the user
        list - List item to be written to disk

      • writeList

        public static void writeList(java.io.File file,
                             List list)
        Writes one List to disk in the specified location. Can be used for exporting.
        Parameters:
        file - File object represented the path to the desired location.
        list - List object to be written to disk.

      • removeList

        public static void removeList(java.lang.String userid,
                              java.lang.String listid)
        Delete a List that's in the user's default folder.
        Parameters:
        userid - User ID
        listid - List ID
